summary: I loved the Aggretsuko Xmas special, and from what I understand of how Xmas is seen in Japan, it makes sense that they would...
body:
I loved the Aggretsuko Xmas special, and from what I understand of how Xmas is seen in Japan, it makes sense that they would lean on the romantic story like they did, but like

For me, the real core of the show and it’s relatability is that it’s a slice of life about the frustrations of young adult working life (probably also why that Rocko’s Modern Life crossover art worked so well) and I’d be concerned that if they move away from that into more “relationship” stories, the show might lose something.

I dunno, we’ll see how it goes

tags: That Time I got Reincarnated as a Slime
Rascal Does not Dream of Bunny Girl Senpai
Why are light novel titles so long
title: The Professional Gamer - December 22, 2018
body:
Hello, dear readers! We are now only a few days until Christmas, when lots of kids and geeks will suddenly have a lot of new toys. I of course am no different, at least in my expectations. New toys are something that future me will have. Present me, the one writing this post, has to make due with (mostly) old toys. So, what did I end up spending my time on this week? Anime, cartoons, and video games, but I’ll keep the details below the fold.

Since it is Christmastime, I’ve spent a good bit of free time this week with holiday specials. My favorite is still The Muppets Christmas Carol, which does such a good job of balancing the source material with the zany humor of the Muppets. But, I have a hard time feeling confident with my feelings about it: is this really a good movie, or is my love mostly nostalgia? For example, I’ve been humming “Scrooge”, “One More Sleep ‘Til Christmas” and “It Feels Like Christmas” since Thanksgiving. I added “Marley and Marley” a week or so later. The framing device, with Gonzo acting as Charles Dickens (or the narrator) offers both some of the best laughs and a chance to enjoy more of Dickens prose than would be delivered through character dialog alone.

If I try to put a more critical eye to it, the third ghost is rushed, and doesn’t spend enough time building up the level of dread to the reveal that Scrooge has died and is not mourned by anyone. Portions of the plot centering around the Cratchits always makes me cringe a bit. First, because I’m not huge on sentimental songs like “Bless Us All”. Second, because I’ve really grown to dislike Ms. Piggy. Maybe dislike is too strong of a word, but I certainly do not enjoy the style of humor that is used with her.

In the end, I’m not a good enough critic to properly evaluate this conundrum. I enjoy watching The Muppets Christmas Carol as part of my personally traditions around the holidays. And, in that way it has value. To quote “I believe [it] has done me good and will do me good and I say ‘God Bless It’”.


In the overlap of the worlds of Christmas and Geek is the Aggretsuko special A Very Metal Christmas. It’s about the same length as a regular episode and details Retsuko’s addiction to social media popularity as well as Haida pining after Retsuko. It’s fun, much like the rest of the series, and just builds my anticipation for the next season.

Continuing on to the more geeky domains: Skull-face Bookseller Honda-san and That Time I got Reincarnated as a Slime continue to be the best series this season. Maybe I should clarify. They’re the only series that have held my attention this season. Feeling like I had nothing else to watch, I decided to put on the first episode of Rascal Does not Dream of Bunny Girl Senpai, and boy is that a weird show. I’d seen a few other critics, who’s opinions I respect, speaking highly of it earlier in the season. I’m going to try to give it the requisite 3 episodes before I pass final judgement.

Lastly, I’ve been enjoying Elite: Dangerous as a game to play while Crystal is playing Dragon Quest or we are watching a show together. The changes to exploration are great. And for me, the best thing has been that I did not have to fly back to civilized space to restock my ship. My pre-patch setup works great for what I want to do: completionist system mapping. I’ve again set my sights on Colonia, with a plan to bring a huge stack of data into port with me. It’s a long ways away, and since I want to gather a lot of data, its going to take me a long time to get there. Maybe I can get there by next Christmas!

That’s all that I have for this week. I start two weeks of vacation now, and should have a post-Christmas report up next weekend. Until then, Happy Holidays and game on!

blog.name: thelovelydeer
blog.title: Another Fandom Blog
blog.description: Main Fandoms:Trollhunters and TBOL. I have too many OCs

title: Netflix 2018
body:
I haven’t been watching a lot of shows because of my wedding and a new job this year. But this is what I watched (and enjoyed) in 2018!

Trollhunters

I got into the fandom this year. Before season 3 release. I adore Trollhunters. I love the characters, how it looks, the story. Everything about this show I love (expect for Merlin but everyone hates Merlin)

3Below

A spin off show for Trollhunters. I just finish this show yesterday and I love it! I love the style of the aliens. I love the story. And it’s a nice addition to Trollhunters.

Aggretsuko

I started my first office this year. And while I enjoy my job and I like my co-workers, it’s hard. Some days I don’t want to get up early, dress up nice, going on a crowded subway, and work. But you have too because you need to make money and keep your job. That is why I love Aggretsuko so much. I can relate to the main character so much.

She-Ra

Major girl power show! I honestly love this show! The character design is amazing! I love the story and I’m always on the edge of my seat near the end of the show! This show is a great show for children and children at heart!

M.A.D.: M-uppets, A-nime, D-isney (and more)! | 30 years old | Fanfiction Writer |

Don't be afraid to say hello! Hope to hear more from you guys!
~Rikareena

summary: Haida is clearly my favorite Aggretsuko character, but I also love Fenneko for having Haida's back, just enough to support him...
body: Haida is clearly my favorite Aggretsuko character, but I also love Fenneko for having Haida’s back, just enough to support him and give him a push, but not enough to actually interfere the dynamic between him a Retsuko. She’s also great, protective friend of both him and Retsuko! She’s awesome!

reblog.comment: Haida is clearly my favorite Aggretsuko character, but I also love Fenneko for having Haida’s back, just enough to support him and give him a push, but not enough to actually interfere the dynamic between him a Retsuko. She’s also great, protective friend of both him and Retsuko! She’s awesome!
